intro: Calystegia discolor, commonly known as the pale morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a trailing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from white to pale purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes other flowering vines and herbs.
